review: I bought this hoping to cut down on cable costs - unless you never ever want to know what is going on in the world or watch any current television shows I would recommend not buying this. I don't watch that much television but I still think that this was a waste of money. It also has some bugs in it - the one thing I was most excited about was the mlb.tv (for some reason if I pay for a subscription through Verizon the signal scrambles and I cannot watch). Last nite I sat down to watch a game only games don't load. Spoke with a great customer service rep who told me it "was a known issue." They expect to have it corrected soon. So, yesterday in addition to the cost to buy this nifty box I spent $19.99 for something that right now I cannot watch.My plan was to remove one cable box and see what this was like before my contract with the cable company is up in a few months. I placed it where I thought I wanted it. About two hours later I wanted to see local news - cannot do that with this box. I typically watch "CBS this morning" on Sunday - cannot do that. Did I know this before I purchased? I did but did not realize how annoying I would find it. I am not sure long term unless these not-cable boxes can get some local programming (why don't they have a built in antenna so you can get local stations?) or HGTV-like stations that they will ever be mainstream. So this morning I am now wondering which other TV to connect it to - if I put it in the main living area and someone visits and wants to see something that's "on tv" do we all go in and sit on the bed to watch the TV with cable? Because remember my plan was not to have an adjunct to cable but to save money - this will not do that I don't believe.Do I like it? Sure it came well packaged and is cute. As someone who hates cords and cable boxes this is a definite improvement. It is slick and the remote is pretty nice. But now I am going to have to connect it AND my cable box to a TV which has saved nothing (actually cost me money) and just given me more electricity expense (you cannot it seems turn this off either) and boxes sitting around - sigh.But, you say if you have prime you get to watch free movies. Quite honestly, they don't look all that great, and I could have watched on my computer anyhow. Cable has a bunch of old movies or movies to purchase also. I can listen to music on cable (and actually prefer those stations to pandora, which seems clumsy and difficult to work with on the TV). Am I returning this? No, I have great hopes for the future of these boxes. But it fails utterly to meet the needs of a consumer who wants to save money on cable. This is not unique to this device - they are all the same way when it comes to local programming and what are typically cable-tv shows. So, unless you just want a new gadget to sit around because you like new things save your money - the cost of this will pay half a month's Verizon bill :)
